page.title: 01Description of The Area
page.content: The landscape is one of rolling hills and deep valleys.Much of the farmland is wedged between two main roads,the A38 and the A390. On the north side of the A38 the River Fowey meanders through the beautifully wooded Glynn Valley. On the south side of the A38 the main Paddington to Penzance railway follows the road.Three viaducts cross the valleys in close succession. The community is a rural farming one with West Taphouse having the most houses in the area.The A390 splits the once quiet hamlet. Some of the land is Forestry Commission property,and most of the land is owned by Boconnoc Estate. Many Tumuli can be seen to the west of West Taphouse. These date back to the Bronze Age.
